candidates.title: axum-core: Version 0.2.3
candidates.body: Gonna do one for axum when this is out.

candidates.title: axum: Version 0.5.3
candidates.body:
I realized we should keep the changelog entry for the breaking change for version 0.5.2, so added it back here.

Also bumped the version of axum-core to make sure we get the re-export of `AppendHeaders`.

candidates.title: Remove unnecessary default features for axum from axum-extra
candidates.body:
axum-extra does not need any features from axum.
I'd like to use axum-extra without including axum's default features.

candidates.title: Add `SpaRouter`
candidates.body:
This adds `SpaRouter` to axum-extra. It makes it easy to get a routing setup common with single page apps.

Assets will be served using `ServeDir` from a nested path, unknown routes goes to some index file.

candidates.title: Add "stream to file" example
candidates.body: A few people have asked how to stream requests bodies to a file without buffering everything in memory. So I figure its worth adding an example for. Basically just putting together some combinators that exist already.

candidates.title: `PrivateCookieJar` for managing private cookies
candidates.body:
Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/896

Its pretty much identical to `SignedCookieJar` but private.

candidates.title: Copy over changelogs from v0.4.x branch
Add example for consuming request body in middleware and extractor
candidates.body: Gotten a few questions lately about how to consume the request body in middleware and extractors. So this adds an example for it.

candidates.title: Update to matchit 0.5
candidates.body: No changes other than cleaning up matchit's api.

candidates.title: Fix nesting of opaque services that paths that contain params
candidates.body:
While working on https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/830 I discovered that nesting opaque services at paths that contain params was totally broken. Things like

```rust
let api_routes = Router::new().route("/:b", get(|| async {})).boxed_clone();
let app = Router::new().nest("/:a", api_routes);
```

We would try and strip the prefix as `/:a` but thats a placeholder that should match anything. It shouldn't be used as the literal prefix.

This required some changes to [`StripPrefix`](https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/blob/main/axum%2Fsrc%2Frouting%2Fstrip_prefix.rs). I also added a bunch more tests and some property tests to get better coverage against panics.

candidates.title: Replace set_var usage in examples
candidates.body:
## Motivation

`set_var`'s safety is at odds with `std` calling into libc which can read the environment without taking a lock at basically any point. Rust is moving towards deprecating the ability to call it in safe code, or the whole function (which approach wins is not yet decided AFAIK).

## Solution

Don't use `set_var`. It's possible to supply a default value to the tracing_subscriber `EnvFilter` if `RUST_LOG` isn't set in different ways (I have taken the easiest approach I could find).

Side note: The examples are a bit inconsistent about whether they

* Initialize `tracing_subscriber` with a `RUST_LOG` fallback value
* Initialize `tracing_subscriber` without `RUST_LOG` fallback
* Don't initialize `tracing_subscriber` at all

Should we initialize it the same way everywhere?

candidates.title: Add cookie management to axum-extra
axum: Version 0.4.7
candidates.body:
- **added:** Implement `tower::Layer` for `Extension` ([#801])
- **changed:** Deprecate `AddExtensionLayer`. Use `Extension` instead ([#805])

[#801]: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/801
[#805]: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/805

candidates.title: Fix some `examples/*` little problems.
candidates.body:
## Motivation
Unused dependencies
Miss docs: `cargo run -p example...`


## Solution
Some examples use `println!("Playground: http://localhost:3000")` but `trace`, so I just delete `trace` and `tracing-subscriber` dependencies.
Some examples import `axum-extra`,but never use it, so I just delete it.
`examples/chat` use neither `trace` nor `prinltn`, so I add some `trace` behavior.
`/examples/async-graphql` miss docs `cargo run -p example...` liking other examples,so I add doc add the code top.

Here are lists:
- `examples/chat` deps `trace` and `tracing-subscriber` never be used. Add trace `debug` to `chat`
- remove `examples/reverse-proxy` unused dependencies `tracing-subscriber` and `trace`
- remove `examples/prometheus-metrics` unused dependency `axum-extra`
- remove `examples/print-request-response` unused dependency `axum-extra`
- remove `examples/async-graphql` unused dependencies `tracing-subscriber` and `trace`
- Add docs to `/examples/async-graphql`, just like other examples.
